bill.title: AN ACT TO AMEND TITLES 16 AND 29 OF THE DELAWARE CODE RELATING TO THE RESTORATION OF THE DELAWARE PRESCRIPTION DRUG PAYMENT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM.
bill.abstract: This Act restores the Delaware Prescription Drug Payment Assistance Program (""Program""), which was eliminated in the Fiscal Year 2018 Annual Appropriations Act. This Act replaces Senate Bill 148 and makes the following additional changes: (1) Delays implementation of the Act until January 1, 2019, to coordinate with the Medicare Part D benefit year to enable the Department of Health and Social Services (""Department"") to make necessary system changes. (2) Makes changes to the defined term ""prescription drugs."" (3) Removes provisions required to be included in rules and regulations promulgated by the Department. (4) Adds provisions that may be included in rules and regulations promulgated by the Department. (5) Makes technical corrections to conform the provisions of the restored Program to ...

bill.abstract: Makes technical changes in other parts of GL c.159C to effectuate this redefinition.

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/18/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

bill.title: An Act prohibiting robocalls to all mobile telephone devices
bill.abstract: Amends provisions of GL c.159C (Telephone Solicitations) to authorize the Attorney General to enforce provisions against robocalls. In particular, the AG may initiate proceedings relating to a knowing violation or threatened knowing violation, and may include an injunction, a civil penalty or $1500-$10,000 for each knowing violation and additional relief in a court of competent jurisdiction. The attorney general may also issue investigative demands and subpoenas, administer oaths and conduct hearings in the course of investigating a violation. A person who has received more than 1 unsolicited telephonic call within a 12-month period by or on behalf of the same person or entity in violation of the prohibition on robocalls may also personally bring an action to enjoin the violation, to ...

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/18/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

bill.title: An Act updating Chapter 93H data security protections to include biometric information
bill.abstract: Amends GL 93H:1 to provide a definition for biometric indicators and to further provide that the same shall be considered personal information under GL Chapter 93H (Security Breaches).

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/18/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

bill.title: An Act assuring municipal control of military equipment procurement by local law enforcement
bill.abstract: Amends GL 44:53A1/2, the statute governing gifts of tangible personal property to municipalities, to expressly prohibit police and fire departments from applying for military style weapons such as drones, armored vehicles, etc. from the U.S. DOHS, DOD, DOJ, or other agency without the prior authorization of the correct governing body of the municipality.

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/18/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

bill.title: An Act relative to a report on additional tax reporting requirements
bill.abstract: Department of Revenue by a year.Section 125 requires the Commissioner of Revenue to report on how he has used the authority granted in the budget to depart from federal requirements for 1099-K reporting (used to report income received from income received from electronic payments such as credit cards, debit cards, PayPal, and other third party payers). Currently, 1099-K reporting is carried out during the first two months of a calendar year, and the affected taxpayers may file the affected returns and pay their taxes as late as October of that calendar year. According to the Governor, a report as of March 15 of that calendar year will not be able to provide meaningful fiscal information. A reporting date of March 15, 2019 will allow for the preparation of a meaningful evaluation of the ...

sponsor.name: Joint Committee on Telecommunications, Utilities & Energy

bill.title: An Act relative to hydro
bill.abstract: Amends GL 25A:11F relating to the renewable energy portfolio standard for retail electricity suppliers; defines relicensed hydroelectric facilities that receive a new license after January 1, 2018 under the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission Rules, as Class I renewable energy generating sources; requires relicensed hydroelectric facilities seeking to operate as a Class I renewable energy generating source to provide formal notice to the department of energy resources. (New draft of HB2697. The new draft replaces the prior text pertaining to net metering tariffs for small hydroelectric power net metering facilities, with new language relating to classification of relicensed hydroelectric facilities as Class I renewable energy generating sources.)

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/18/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

bill.title: An Act making appropriations for fiscal year 2019
bill.abstract: The \'printed-as-amended\' House-engrossed budget appropriates $44,589,746,517 in 1175 line-items. Broken down by category, this includes $38,717,595,403 in direct appropriations, $497,119,509 in chargebacks, $526,270,924 in reserve accounts, $564,472,641 in retained revenues, $2,596,231,508 in federal grants, and $1,688,056,532 in operating transfers. The largest items, as usual, include $5.7 billion for MassHealth managed care, $4.8 billion for Chapter 70 payments to cities and towns, $3.5 billion for MassHealth Senior Care, $2.6 billion for MassHealth fee for service payments, $2.1 billion for consolidated long term debt service, $2.1 billion for MassHealth affordable care act expansion populations, $1.7 billion for Group Insurance premium and plan costs, $1.1 billion for community ...

bill.title: Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018
bill.abstract: <p><b>Agriculture and Nutrition Act of 2018 </b></p> <p>This bill (commonly known as the farm bill) reauthorizes through FY2023 and modifies Department of Agriculture (USDA) programs that address:</p> <ul> <li>commodity support, </li> <li> conservation, </li> <li> trade and international food aid, </li> <li> nutrition assistance, </li> <li>farm credit, </li> <li> rural development, </li> <li> research and extension activities,</li> <li> forestry, </li> <li>horticulture, and </li> <li> crop insurance. </li> </ul> <p>The bill modifies agriculture and nutrition policies to: </p> <ul> <li> expand the work requirements and modify the eligibility rules for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP, formerly known as the food stamp program), </li> <li> repeal the Conservation ...

bill.title: To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to delay the reduction in Federal medical assistance percentage for Medicaid personal care services furnished without an electronic visit verification system, and for other purposes.
bill.abstract: ...This bill delays by one year (to January 1, 2020) the Medicaid federal matching rate reduction that is scheduled to take effect for states that fail to require an electronic visit verification system for personal care services. The bill also excludes specified services from such verification system requirements, including inpatient hospital services and 24-hour residential group home services. </p>

status.statusval: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.title: To modernize U.S. markets and to promote capital formation, investor confidence, and economic growth, and for other purposes
bill.abstract: <p><b>Encouraging Employee Ownership Act</b> </p> <p>This bill requires the Securities and Exchange Commission to increase, from $5 million to $10 million, the 12-month sales threshold beyond which an issuer is required to provide investors with additional disclosures related to compensatory benefit plans.</p>
